intro: Scandix verna var. eriocarpa, commonly known as the early scurvy grass, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are finely divided and often covered with a soft, woolly coating. This variety is notable for its early flowering habit and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
